metadata.title: CVE-2016-2853 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The aufs module for the Linux kernel 3.x and 4.x does not properly restrictthe mount namespace, which allows local users to gain privileges bymounting an aufs filesystem on top of a FUSE filesystem, and then executinga crafted setuid program.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-kvm - 4.4.0-1103.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
